title: Preparing Americans for High-Paying Skilled Trade Jobs of the Future

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to improve and better coordinate workforce development programs to prepare American workers for high-paying skilled trade jobs. It emphasizes expanding registered apprenticeships, investing in upskilling workers including the use of artificial intelligence, and increasing transparency and accountability in federal workforce programs.
potential_concerns: Fragmentation of workforce programs may persist if agencies fail to fully integrate under the proposed reviews and reforms.
Expansion of registered apprenticeships may not equally benefit all industries or demographic groups, potentially leaving some workers behind.
Increased emphasis on alternative credentials could face resistance from traditional educational institutions and accreditation bodies.
Reliance on artificial intelligence in workforce training may create challenges related to bias, accessibility, and worker displacement.
Transparency requirements may impose additional administrative burdens on federal agencies and program grantees.
